etymology.description: 睪(睪) (yì, 'armpit/to release') originally -> changed to 𠬤(𠬤) (shì, 'release') within 釋(釋) (shì, 'explain/release') -> final form 释(釋)
etymology.interpretation: The character 释(釋) (shì, 'Buddha/to explain/to release') involves a simplified process where 睪(睪) (yì) was replaced by the simpler 𠬤(𠬤) (shì) to better capture the sense of release and explanation, resulting in a streamlined representation of 释(釋).
etymology.simplification: 释(釋) simplifies by replacing the complex 睪(睪) (yì) with the more straightforward 𠬤(𠬤) (shì) to enhance readability and efficiency in writing.

examples.chinese: 释迦牟尼是佛教创始人(釋迦牟尼是佛教創始人)。
examples.english: Shakyamuni is the founder of Buddhism.

examples.chinese: 老师释疑(老師釋疑)，平息学生疑惑(平息學生疑惑)。
examples.english: The teacher explains doubts, easing the students' confusion.

examples.chinese: 法官释囚犯(法官釋囚犯)，给予新生机会(給予新生機會)。
examples.pinyin: Fǎguān shì qiúfàn, jǐyǔ xīnshēng jīhuì.
examples.english: The judge releases the prisoners, giving them a chance at a new life.
